thread.title: Wildcats down to Auburn at half 23-10
thread.title_full: Wildcats down to Auburn at half 23-10

title: Wildcats down to Auburn at half 23-10
text:
Wildcats down to Auburn at half 23-10 Cats Going For Just 2nd Win Over Tigers In 18 Tries UPDATED 8:45 PM EDT Oct 15, 2015 
Auburn hits a 52-yard field goal to put UK in a 23-10 hole at halftime. Related Funding announced for broadband... 
The Cats will begin their second-half comeback bid with the ball. 
UK Football's got a big game Thursday night. Big. Huge. Massive. No, this isn't the Auburn team that was predicted to win the SEC Championship. In fact The Tigers are still looking for their first SEC win of the fall. But this is big anyway. 
This is a rare moment in the national solo Thursday night spotlight for Kentucky. Even rarer that The Wildcats have traction in year three under Head Coach Mark Stoops. Records of (4-1/2-1) alone in second place in the SEC East. Not bad for a team that's never won a division title, much less been to the postseason at all the last 5 years. 
It gets better. 
The Wildcats have lost 16 of their last 17 to The Tigers. Haven't beaten them in Lexington since 1966. A win now even over an average Auburn team continues the positive Cats vibe and makes Quarterback Patrick Towles look like a sage more and more. Remember his pre-season comments? Why can't they compete for the SEC East Title? Many jaws were dropped. Many more laughed. Not so many are laughing anymore. And the UK bandwagon will get significantly heavier if it can get its second quality win of the season now, adding to the credibility earned by beating Missouri. 
This could be the start of something big. 
The Wildcats and Tigers kickoff Thursday at 7 p.m. at Commonwealth Stadium in Lexington. Tags UK Kentucky Wildcats Football 
ABOUT THIS. KENTUCKY HOSTS AUBURN TONIGHT. AND UK HAS NOT HAD A LOT OF SUCCESS AGAINST THE TIGERS. BUT COACH STOOPS SAYS HIS TEAM IS READY AND HOPES FOR A WIN. SPORTS DIRECTOR FRED COWGILL IS LIVE AT COMMONWEALTH STADIUM WHERE THE GAME KICKSOFF AT 7:30. FRED. FRED: HELLO AGAIN EVERYBODY. AND WELCOME TO LEXINGTON. WHERE WE'VE GOT A REALLY, REALLY BIG GAME TONIGHT. TAILGATING EVERYWHERE. I CAME TO THE PARTY WITH NO BLUE. THIS YOUNG LADY HELPED ME OUT. IT CAME OFF THE CUP THAT I HAD. I'M A FORMER GIRL SCOUT, WE ARE ALWAYS PREPARED. FRED: TONIGHT AT 7. UK FOOTBALL HOSTS AUBURN. THE CATS HAVE LOST 16 OF THEIR LAST 17 TO THE TIGERS. THE THURSDAY N SPOTLIGHT HAS KENTUCKY CENTER STAGE. WITH A PRICELESS OPPORTUNITY FOR THE CATS AND HEAD COACH MARK STOOPS TO PROVE TO THE USA THEY ARE REALLY READY TO COMPETE FOR ITS FIRST EVER SEC EAST TITLE. KENTUCKY'S RECORDS ARE 4-1 AND 2-1, ALONE IN SECOND PLACE. A WIN KEEPS THEM IN THE HUNT FOR THE AND A ONCE UNTHINKABLE LONGSHOT APPEARANCE IN THE LEAGUE CHAMPIONSHIP GAME. THE KEYS INCLUDE QUARTERBACK PATRIC GAME. AS WELL AS RUNNING BACK BOOM WILLIAMS MISSING THE EKU WIN FOR PERSONAL REASONS. BOOM COULD BE THE DIFFERENCE MAKER AS AUBURN RANKS JUST 88TH IN THE COUNTRY AGAINST THE RUN. I THINK IF YOU LOOK AT WHAT AUBU THEIR OFFENSE IS VERY HARD TO DEFEND. SO IT'S BY NO MEANS VERY PREP . YOU'VE HEARD ME SAY IT TIME AND TIME AGAIN, ANYBODY THAT USES THE QUARTERBACK IN THE RUN GAME PUS THEN ADDING NUMBERS AND TAKING SHOTS DOWN THE FIELD AND SO ON. FRED: THE LAST TIME THE CATS BEAT THE TIGERS WAS 2009. BEFORE T YOU HAVE TO GO ALL THE WAY BACK TO THE YEAR 1966 FOR THE LAST KENTUCKY WIN OVER AUBURN. WHERE SCARF.
